result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Fowler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
To be paid before any court costs, fees, assessments.
Set as follow:  $665.00 to Speedway 9130 W. Oklahoma Avenue, Milwaukee and read ins, $10.00 to Speedway on National Avenue; $286.00 to Subway locatd at 7630 W. Bluemound Road.

Pay  DNA surcharge, Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid during term of Extended supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  
Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving the first 2 1/2 years of sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school fulltime, defendant to have a part time job.
Mental health assessment. Cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating  physician.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with Cousins Subs located at 9125 W. Lincoln Avenue, Speedway located at 9130 W. Oklahoma Avenue, Little Caesars located at 3161 S. 76 Street, Speedway on National Avenue, Subway located at 7630 W. Bluemound Road.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavior Modification Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.  No alcohol or controlled substances.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay the related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election  until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R Fowler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original CONTINUED SENTENCING Transcript (36 pages) commencing 09/21/2015 received and filed.  CH
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form received and filed.

Defendant Michael R Fowler in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Michael R Fowler in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 9 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5  YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 265 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving the first 2 1/2 years of sentence
-Restitution set as follows: $665.00 to Speedway located at 9130 W. Oklahoma Avenue, Milwaukee and Read-ins:  $10.00 to Speedway on National Avenue ; $286.00 to Subway located at 7630 W. Bluemound Road;  Restitution to be paid before any Court costs, fees and assessments and are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Vocational assessment; participate in any programs recommended 
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician
-No contact with Cousins Subs located at 9125 W. Lincoln Avenue; Speedway located at 9130 W. Oklahoma Avenue; Little Ceasars located at 3161 S. 76th Street; Speedway on National Avenue; Subway located at 7630 W. Bluemound Road
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Defendant Michael R Fowler in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Michael R Fowler in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by Attorney D. Michael Gerin; Michael Fowler, Sr.  Matter adjourned to 1:30 p.m. this date for continuation of sentencing.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Michael R Fowler not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference conducted.  Matter set for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Michael R Fowler not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discussions held off the record.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Michael R Fowler not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for sentencing, however Branch 21 is in jury trial, case adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Michael R Fowler not in court, in custody.  
Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Sentencing hearing.  The Court is unable to hear this matter due to the lateness of the hour; adjourned date selected with the parties.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing Memorandum received from defense, filed.
and Restitution Worksheet, received and filed.

Defendant Michael R Fowler in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Michael R Fowler in custody.  
Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on state's motion the Court orders Counts 1 and 3 DISMISSED AND READ-IN for the purpose of sentencing in Count 2.

Parties stipulate to the following uncharged incidents being read-in for the purpose of sentencing:  West Allis Police Department #1411357, #1411539, and Wauwatosa Police Department #1435826.

State does not seek change in bail status.  Date selected before Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Michael R Fowler not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Defense request for a plea and sentence date is granted by the court.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 21  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-25-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael R Fowler in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Michael R Fowler in custody.  Ronald Dague for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Caleb Porter-West Allis Police Department Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with COUSINS SUBS, SPEEDWAY, LITTLE CEASARS, CHRISTOPHER R., DANIELLE B., AND JESSICA C.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael R Fowler in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Michael R Fowler in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
